biweekly.io

Class WriteContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.io.WriteContext

  • public class WriteContext
extends Object
    Stores information used to write the properties in an iCalendar object.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WriteContext(ICalVersion version, TimezoneInfo timezoneOptions, TimezoneAssignment globalTimezone) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDate(ICalDate date, boolean floating, TimeZone tz)
      Records the timezoned date-time values that are being written.
      List<Date> getDates()
      Gets the timezoned date-time property values that are in the iCalendar object.
      TimezoneAssignment getGlobalTimezone()
      Gets the global timezone to format all date/time values in, regardless of each individual ICalendar's timezone settings.
      ICalComponent getParent()
      Gets the parent component of the property that is being written.
      TimezoneInfo getTimezoneInfo()
      Gets the timezone options for this iCalendar object.
      ICalVersion getVersion()
      Gets the version of the iCalendar object that is being written.
      void setParent(ICalComponent parent)
      Sets the parent component of the property that is being written.

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public ICalVersion getVersion()
        Gets the version of the iCalendar object that is being written.
        Returns:
        the iCalendar version

      • getTimezoneInfo

        public TimezoneInfo getTimezoneInfo()
        Gets the timezone options for this iCalendar object.
        Returns:
        the timezone options

      • getGlobalTimezone

        public TimezoneAssignment getGlobalTimezone()
        Gets the global timezone to format all date/time values in, regardless of each individual ICalendar's timezone settings.
        Returns:
        the global timezone or null if not set

      • getParent

        public ICalComponent getParent()
        Gets the parent component of the property that is being written.
        Returns:
        the parent component

      • setParent

        public void setParent(ICalComponent parent)
        Sets the parent component of the property that is being written.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent component

      • getDates

        public List<Date> getDates()
        Gets the timezoned date-time property values that are in the iCalendar object.
        Returns:
        the timezoned date-time property values

      • addDate

        public void addDate(ICalDate date,
                    boolean floating,
                    TimeZone tz)
        Records the timezoned date-time values that are being written. This is used to generate a DAYLIGHT property for vCalendar objects.
        Parameters:
        floating - true if the date is floating, false if not
        tz - the timezone to format the date in or null for UTC
        date - the date value
